item.title: NPC talking. <last post is especially enjoyable>
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

If you mean getting the NPC to shout out, then yes. I need it to make it look effective.

If you mean the compiler copying thing, still yes. Ask anyone that knew about the development, I worked my ass off getting that to work. I don’t mind people opening it, bisecting it, removing some code and using it, but completely copying it and not even showing my name in credits is something else. It’s rather annoying. I’m going to start putting anti-edits if it continues.

Read full topic
item.source: NPC talking. <last post is especially enjoyable>

item.title: NPC talking. <last post is especially enjoyable>
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

OK, I’ll look deeper into it. But one other thing. How much more could possibly leech my compiler you little sh*t. It’s comparible to cloning someone, shaving their head and saying their completely different. I ask that you remove it.

I’m serious, anyone reading this, download the one in his signature, download the one in mine right-click and edit them both and see the similarities. On second thoughts, try you utmost hardest to spot any differences.

I mean, the guy hasn’t even made hardly any changes. Here is a bock of code from my compiler:

@echo off

:def
set b=0
set t=F
color %b%%t%

:main
cls
title Solumstone Compiler
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo :: Welcome to Solumstone Compiler V5!
echo :: 
echo :: Choose an option below by entering that symbol
echo :: and pressing enter. Need a batch file created?
echo :: PM Syrillia on Moparscape or e-mail
echo :: lillutonboi@hotmail.co.uk.
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo :::: Main options:
echo :::: c = Compile your server.
echo :::: r = Run your server.
echo :::: b = Backup your server files.
echo :::: r2 = Runs your server with autorestart.
echo :::: 
echo :::: Other options;
echo :::: s = Change settings.
echo :::: l = Location list (co-ordinates)
echo :::: u = Updates
echo :::: cmd = command generator
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo ::
set /p mc=:: Choice:

if %mc%==c goto com
if %mc%==r goto run
if %mc%==b goto bac
if %mc%==s goto set
if %mc%==l goto loc
if %mc%==u goto upd
if %mc%==cmd goto cmd
if %mc%==r2 goto aur
if %mc%==C goto com
if %mc%==R goto run
if %mc%==B goto bac
if %mc%==S goto set
if %mc%==L goto loc
if %mc%==U goto upd
if %mc%==CMD goto cmd
if %mc%==R2 goto aur
goto main

:com
cls
title Compiling...
echo :: Server Compiling...
echo :: Auto-setting envriomental variables.
echo ::
echo ::Results:
goto com2

Now let’s check out a block from his:

@echo off

:def
set t=0
set b=7
color %b%%t%

:main
title Piiwii's Compiler v1.5
echo :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo :: Welcome to Piiwii's Compiler! v1.5
echo :: 
echo :: Choose an option below by entering that symbol
echo :: and pressing enter. Need Help?
echo :: PM Piiwii on Moparscape
echo ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo :::: Main options:
echo :::: c = Compile your server.
echo :::: r = Run your server.
echo :::: b = Backup your servers files.
echo :::: ra = run with auto restarter.
echo :::: 	 
echo :::: Other things:
echo :::: s = Change settings.
echo :::: cords = Location list (co-ordinates)
echo :::: cmd = command generator
echo :::: reset = Reset's your compile logs.
echo :::: up = lastes updates
echo::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
echo ::
set /p mc=:: Choice:

if %mc%==c goto com
if %mc%==r goto run
if %mc%==b goto bac
if %mc%==s goto set
if %mc%==cords goto loc
if %mc%==cmd goto cmd
if %mc%==ra goto aur
if %mc%==reset goto reset
if %mc%==C goto com
if %mc%==R goto run
if %mc%==B goto bac
if %mc%==S goto set
if %mc%==CORDS goto loc
if %mc%==CMD goto cmd
if %mc%==RA goto aur
if %mc%==RESET goto reset
if %mc%==up goto up
if %mc%==UP goto up
goto main

:com
cls
title Compiling...
echo :: Server Compiling
echo ::
echo ::Results:
goto com2

Spot the difference guys!

Still need help with NPC handler though. Just in case someone has the answer.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @piiwii piiwii
item.description:
@piiwii wrote:

try this your ({) and (}) are not in the right spot

if (npcs[i].npcType == 661) { if (misc.random2(20) == 1) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome!"; } }

you forgot the (}) that close’s up the 2 you have uptop

item.title: NPC talking. <last post is especially enjoyable>
item.dc:creator: @Syrillia Syrillia
item.description:
@Syrillia wrote:

I’ve put this code into my NPChandler:

						if (npcs[i].npcType == 661) {
                                                if(misc.random(15) == 1) {
							npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
							npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
							npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome!";
                                                }

and I compile, I get no error, but the NPC still doesn’t talk. Any Help?
